item.title: Canterbury - Wikipedia
item.description: Canterbury (/ ˈkæntərb (ə) ri / ⓘ, /- bɛri /) [2] is a city and UNESCO World Heritage Site, in the Canterbury district, in the county of Kent, England; it was a county borough until 1974. It lies on the River Stour. The city has a mild oceanic climate.

item.title: The Commons At Canterbury – Broken Arrow Townhomes
item.description: The Commons at Canterbury is a townhome community comprised of 94 privately owned homes. The Commons address is 2408 W Quantico St., Broken Arrow, OK 74011. The Commons does not have a business office nor does it have paid employees. Board members are homeowners who volunteer their time.

item.title: Visit Canterbury
item.description: Experience winter in one of the most beautiful parts of England. In the heart of Kent and just under one hour's train drive from London, Canterbury is a medieval walled city that has been hosting visitors for more than 1,000 years - so a warm welcome for any 'pilgrim' is guaranteed!

item.title: The 12 best things to do in Canterbury, England - Lonely Planet
item.description: Discover the best things to do in Canterbury, from historic cathedrals and museums to scenic river tours and charming pubs.

item.title: Canterbury | Location, Cathedral, History, & Facts | Britannica
item.description: Canterbury is a historic town and surrounding city (local authority) in the administrative and historic county of Kent, southeastern England. Its cathedral has been the primary ecclesiastical center of England since the early 7th century CE.

item.title: 10 Best Things To Do In Canterbury That Make A Visit Worth It (+ map)
item.description: But I can attest that if you love York and enjoy top historical cities in England, then you’ll absolutely love Canterbury. Even if you only have an afternoon to explore, here are the 10 best things to do in Canterbury and why you really must go!

item.title: THE 15 BEST Things to Do in Canterbury (2026) - Tripadvisor
item.description: Explore its unique history and take in some of the most iconic views in the county of Kent.

item.title: 12 Unique Things to do in Canterbury - Travel Magazine
item.description: Made famous by its impressive cathedral, imposing castle and the country´s oldest church, there’s no shortage of great things to see and do in Canterbury, with thousands flocking to the magnificent medieval city every year.

item.title: Canterbury - Simple English Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
item.description: Canterbury was once the main settlement of the Celtic tribe of the Cantiaci, which lived in most of modern-day Kent. In the 1st century AD, the Romans captured the settlement and named it Durovernum Cantiacorum. [4]

item.title: Canterbury, England: All You Must Know Before You Go (2026 ...
item.description: In the Middle Ages, Canterbury’s pilgrimage-site status made it the setting of Chaucer’s seminal "Canterbury Tales," while today, cobbled streets and the 6th-century Canterbury Cathedral secure this city as one of England’s must-visit destinations.
